metadata.Title: CVE-2014-2856 on Ubuntu 14.04 ESM (trusty) - medium.
metadata.Description:
Cross-site scripting (XSS) vulnerability in scheduler/client.c in Common Unix Printing System (CUPS) before 1.7.2 allows remote attackers to inject arbitrary web script or HTML via the URL path, related to the is_path_absolute function.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2014-2856` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

cups - 1.7.2-0ubuntu1
cups-bsd - 1.7.2-0ubuntu1
cups-client - 1.7.2-0ubuntu1
cups-common - 1.7.2-0ubuntu1
cups-core-drivers - 1.7.2-0ubuntu1
cups-daemon - 1.7.2-0ubuntu1
cups-ppdc - 1.7.2-0ubuntu1
cups-server-common - 1.7.2-0ubuntu1
libcups2 - 1.7.2-0ubuntu1
libcupscgi1 - 1.7.2-0ubuntu1
libcupsimage2 - 1.7.2-0ubuntu1
libcupsmime1 - 1.7.2-0ubuntu1
libcupsppdc1 - 1.7.2-0ubuntu1
No subscription required

notes.Note: mdeslaur> successfully reproduced on lucid+ patch in bug is what's in 1.7.2

criterions.comment: cups package in trusty was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '1.7.2-0ubuntu1').
